title: Big Tech’s Soaring Spending on AI Is Eating Into Stock Buybacks
description: After years of funneling cash to investors through stock buybacks, big technology companies are reining in that spending as they race to sink more money into artificial intelligence.
content:
After years of funneling cash to investors through stock buybacks, big technology companies are reining in that spending as they race to sink more money into artificial intelligence.

title: Policymakers should ensure ethical AI solutions without compromising data privacy: Salesforce
description: NEW DELHI, Feb 20:  The adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) will not be a challenge in India, and policymakers should ensure that solutions are offered to people ethically without compromising their data privacy, according to Arundhati Bhattacharya, President and CEO of Salesforce, South Asia. Addressing a session at India AI Summit 2026, she also stressed the need to democratise technology to have an impact. “AI is going to solve a lot of problems which otherwise in a populous nation like […]
content:

title: 'AI can't solve Delhi traffic': Ex-UK PM Rishi Sunak jokes after getting late to AI Impact Summit
description: During the high profile India AI Impact Summit in New Delhi, former British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak captured the audience's attention with a blend of sharp wit and strategic insight. After arriving slightly late due to the city’s dense traffic, Sunak joked that even the most powerful artificial intelligence is currently no match for a Delhi gridlock.
content: In a lively opening at the India AI Impact Summit 2026, former British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak brought a touch of humour to the prestigious Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi. Despite the high tech nature of the gathering, the start of the session was d... [2582 chars]

title: After 11,000 Layoffs, Accenture introduces new rule making AI usage mandatory for senior staff promotions and leadership growth
description: After 11,000 layoffs, Accenture links AI tool usage to senior staff appraisals, making artificial intelligence adoption essential for leadership promotions and career growth in the company.
content:
After laying off 11,000 employees, Accenture now ties AI usage to senior staff appraisals, making artificial intelligence adoption mandatory for leadership promotions in a major corporate policy shift.

title: AI can help India realise 'Viksit Bharat' dream, says IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva
description: India Business News: IMF managing director Kristalina Georgieva said that artificial intelligence can fulfil India's ambition of Viksit Bharat while boosting global growth.
content:

title: Council's Jay Bavisi Urges AI Workforce Shift at India AI Summit 2026
description: New Delhi [India], February 20: The India - AI Impact Summit 2026, hosted by the Government of India under the India AI Mission at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi, marked a defining global inflection point that framed the transition from AI aspiration to measurable national and enterprise outcomes. Anchored in the principles of People, Planet, and Progress, the Summit outlined a future where artificial intelligence advances humanity, enables inclusive economic expansion, and strengthens long-term sustainability.

title: ByteDance to further develop US-based AI teams
description: TikTok parent ByteDance is going to create new opportunities in the US within its artificial intelligence (AI) division.
content:
Reportedly, the organisation intends to employ up to 100 additional employees within its artificial intelligence teams, in order to ‘compete with leading US companies’.

title: Mixed Signals Churn Stock Market Despite Recent Highs
description: Major indexes have mostly been treading water for months, as investors’ exuberance for artificial intelligence wears off.

title: A.I. Isn’t Coming for Every White-Collar Job. At Least Not Yet.
description: Tech workers are increasingly worried that the artificial intelligence they are building will replace them. But some are optimistic that it is just one more tool to work with.
content:
In January, Perry Metzger, a computer programmer living outside Boston, tested the limits of an artificial intelligence technology called Codex.
